attributes.action: reform the independent school sector by setting up an Ombudsman or appeal committee
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There are over 500,000 children being privately educated in the U.K. (Figures from the Independent Schools Council, 30.4.08).  They relieve the taxpayer of a burden of nearly £3 billion and parents already pay twice, by passing a place on a state school.  For these children and their parents, there is no accountability - a state of affairs which is totally unacceptable and undemocratic.
We need an Ombudsman or appeal committee for parents and teachers to apply to if they've failed to reach a satisfactory reply from the Headteacher and Governing Body.
Also the system of publising annual League Tables needs abolishing, because they are divisive and encourage schools to exclude children on purely educational grounds.  They are even deemed by some headmasters as being 'a cancer on the face of education'.
